definition[0]: to put stitches in cloth or a wound in order to fasten parts of it together
example[0]: She stitched up the cut and left it to heal.
definition[1]: to get a deal or agreement completed satisfactorily so that it cannot be changed
example[1]: The deal was stitched up in minutes.
definition[2]: to deceive someone, especially in order to gain money from them
definition[3]: to make someone seem guilty of a crime by providing false information
definition[4]: a situation in which someone is deliberately deceived
